intro: Machaerina brevistigma, commonly known as the narrow-stigma machaerina, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or gravelly soils. It is often found in low shrubland and is known for its resilience to coastal conditions. Machaerina brevistigma plays an important role in the ecological diversity of New Zealand's coastal ecosystems.
